messages: e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:31): whoa, http://html4all.org/pipermail/list_html4all.org/2007-September/000428.html ...
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (00:34): I second that ellipsis
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:39): since the HTML WG is so openly hostile, he's decided to become more hostile and more open about his hostility?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:40): i've no idea
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:41): i wonder what Opera did wrong
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:42): or the other browser vendors for that matter
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:42): hmm. just about every jibe about html4all on IRC has been based on the irony of "IRC cabal" and actually having a secret mailing list
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:43): yeah, nothing is really based on any technical issues afaict
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:44): they can call us the "IRC cabal" but laughing about their private mailing list is not allowed... oh well, don't think it's my problem

52b4ba716fdb258a8b7cea876731b549 (00:44): There have been occasions where I thought it'd be good to comment on technical issues they've mentioned on their list, but it's hard to do that when you can't post to it
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:45): 52b4ba716fdb258a8b7cea876731b549: I subscribed successfully and am allowed to post
52b4ba716fdb258a8b7cea876731b549 (00:45): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Oh, I hadn't realised they'd changed it now
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (00:48): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: I think the formal complaint over a few jokes in #whatwg set the bar pretty high already
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:51): i wonder which "closed small group" he's referring to
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:51): follow-up from DanC: http://html4all.org/pipermail/list_html4all.org/2007-September/000429.html
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:52): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, I'd suspect the people chatting in #whatwg mostly
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:52): clearly not the whatwg (800+ people and open), nor the #whatwg (the pinacle of openness, with self-hosted archives)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:52): unless he has a new definition of "closed" that i am not aware of
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (00:52): It can be socially closed even if it's technically open
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:53): (which was forwarded, not sure where DanC e-mailed it initially...)
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (00:53): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: Can't be any more closed than a private mailing list
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:54): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: it seems that followup is bound to be misinterpretted
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:55): it seems that DanC just wants *more* editors, not to replace the existing ones

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:55): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: i haven't seen any sign that we are socially closed either, i mean, we actively invited Steven F to the IRC channel yesterday and spoke with him, I didn't see anyone being hostile there.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:57): anyway, as far as i can tell this is just john playing us
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (00:57): when did html4all appear?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:57): he did publically say that he would engage in a mission of divide and conquer
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:57): d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631: early august
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:59): though it didn't become known until late August. I found out only when I returned from Romania at the start of September
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (01:02): was it mentioned on the html-wg list? i must have missed it
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:03): just on IRC
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:03): i think it was "spotted" because @html4all.org was cc'ed in some e-mail or something
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (01:04): http://krijnhoetmer.nl/irc-logs/whatwg/20070824#l-227 seems to be the first mention of the wiki, presumably via Referer
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (01:06): so why is html4all trying to remove the editor of... no don't answer that

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (01:11): I expect they're not a unified monolithic group with a single set of principles that they all agree on, so it's probably better to wonder why certain people want something rather than why the group does
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:23): heh, http://www.royal-tunbridge-wells.org/ longdesc= points to a non-existing URL...
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:23): maybe I should e-mail an open letter
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (01:25): i looked at the html of that page a while ago, i think when we were being called lazy and stupid, it didn't inspire me ...
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:25): if you add .org it points to a 404
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:25): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: as a community leader, i have to ask you to not be so derisive
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (01:26): by we i don't mean you, fwiw
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:26): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, this is a serious accessibility breach, you have to understand
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:27): will stop now
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:27): (i was kidding)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:27): (too)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:28): i was interested to hear that as editor i'm supposed to be doing leadership work in the html working group, though
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (01:28): I want to comment, but the joke would be trouble, and explaining why I don't make the joke would be trouble as well, so I might as well not write this line
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:28): i wonder how i'm allowed to use this new authority
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (01:28): You are our secret google overlord, after all

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (01:29): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: "I don't think this should be solved in Selectors [...] as it would require specific knowledge about which attributes contain qnames et cetera" - but there's already selectors for space-separated-list values and language values, which don't need UAs to have any specific knowledge about attributes
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:31): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2, given foo="x:x" how can I select x in namespace "bar" regardless of what its prefix is?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:31): afaict there's no such syntax
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:32): maybe I should have mentioned that more explicitly...
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (01:32): You solve the problem in Selectors by making new syntax
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:32): that would allow each attribute to take qnames
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:32): ugh
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:33): is | allowed on the RHS yet? it's not, is it?
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (01:33): You can already select elements that have a specific space-separated word in their alt text
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:33): we could have [foo|bar~=xx|yy]
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:33): and [foo|bar=xx|yy]
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:33): aah, blasphemy!
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:33): (like authors would understand _that_)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:34): "please sir, hit me harder, sir"
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (01:46): let's not be down on us authors
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (01:46): we get a hard time as it is
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (01:50): Real authors write their HTML in machine language, and use browser detection to determine which architecture to serve for
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (01:59): you don't realise how sensitive we are, all these hurtful comments about being lazy and stupid ...
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (02:05): The Perl community is nice since laziness is a virtue there

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (02:07): ("It makes you write labor-saving programs that other people will find useful, and document what you wrote so you don't have to answer so many questions about it.")
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (02:07): Sadly stupidity is not considered a good thing
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (02:13): http://html4all.org/pipermail/list_html4all.org/2007-September/000429.html - hmm, they deleted the message?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (02:13): I suppose that's because DanC didn't give them permission to forward it and they did so anyway
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (02:14): not the first time btw: http://html4all.org/pipermail/list_html4all.org/2007-September/000381.html
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (02:14): (although I'm not sure Rich knows about it)
